alert.note: Alert for Chesterfield; Kershaw; Southern Lancaster (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 31 at 1:19PM EDT by NWS Columbia
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Lancaster, northwestern Chesterfield and north central Kershaw Counties through 145 PM EDT... At 118 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Pageland to near Heath Springs. Movement was northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Pageland, Kershaw, Chesterfield, Mt Pisgah, Carolina Sandhills Wildlife Refuge, Jefferson, Ruby, Mount Croghan, Chesterfield Ruby Middle School, Bay Springs Fire Station, Forty Acre Rock Preserve. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 800 PM EDT for central South Carolina.
